zone.line: Chapter X
It was six months after this miserable
conclusion to his long nursed hopes that
I first saw him. He had retired to a
part of the country where he was not
known that he might peacefully
indulge his grief. All the world, by the
death of his beloved Elinor, was changed
to him, and he could no longer remain
in any spot where he had seen her
or where her image mingled with
the most rapturous hopes had p brighten
ed all around with a light of joy which
would now be transformed to a darkness
blacker than midnight since she,
the sun of his life, was set for ever.
He lived for some time never
tooking looking on the light of heaven
but shrou shrouding his eyes in a
perpetual darkness far f far from all
